website_summaries.verdict: An economical smart plug that offers the flexibility to control a wide range of plug-in devices.
pros: Allows you to schedule the smart plug to turn on and off at your convenience
no need for a different hub or a subscription
Enables you to assign a name to smart plug and communicate with it by name when using voice commands
Offers Away mode so you can activate lights and make it look like you're home when you travel
cons: Requires a secure 2.4 GHz WiFi network connection
Less reliable than similar smart plugs

website_summaries.verdict: In spite of a few issues that are common to smart plug technology, this industry leader stands at the top of the pack in features and design.
pros: A top-selling pick and a leader in smart technology
This easy-to-set-up plug doesn't require a hub, has "home away" mode, is voice controlled with Alexa and Google Assistant, and sports a sleek design
cons: Drops in connectivity and occasional failures syncing with voice control have been reported
Sometimes requires resetting, which is easy to do

customer_reviews.title: Easy to setup
customer_reviews.text: I set this up on my Alexa and the Kasa app in less than 30 minutes start to finish. I noticed that sometimes I would say the command, "Alexa turn on lamp," and Alexa would respond "ok" without actually turning anything on. The issue was my 5-year-old router. I replaced the router with a new router that could handle more devices. The new router resolved the issue. I've been using this plug for a few months now and it is still working great.
customer_reviews.author: C. Dunn

customer_reviews.title: You'll get exercise if you buy this (turning on your devices yourself)
customer_reviews.text: Like many others it seems, the TP link plug was working great when purchased a while ago (few months) but is now pretty much worthless. At first, my success rate at getting Alexa to turn on the lights with it was about 90%. Just before the TP link outage and ever since, I'm looking at about a 20% success rate, since it loses connections every other day. You shouldn't be surprised when a device actually works like its supposed to. Last TP link product I ever buy.
customer_reviews.author: Trillian

customer_reviews.title: 50% Failure Rate; No response from TP-Link
customer_reviews.text: I purchased a two-pack of these smart plugs. One works, one doesn't. One of the plugs works like a charm. The other one doesn't stay online for more than 24 hours before losing the LAN convection. They are installed within one foot of another so it isn't a matter of distance or interference. And when the LAN connection is lost, the schedule doesn't function. And when the schedule doesn't work, my hydroponic garden whithers. I have emailed, TP-Link, but after 5 days have received no response. At this point, I will return the devices under the warranty and try a different smart plug.
customer_reviews.author: Databoss

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable at 2.4G; incompatible at 5G. Connection failures common to four units; router checks out fine. Scroll on past.
customer_reviews.text: The device is bulky and does not support 5G WiFi. In addition, its connection to 2.4G WiFi is unstable including at very short distances. I purchased all of these and each had the identical issue; regardless of firmware update or not. I will not spend the money for a sleek version of these. Scenes are useless without the compatible bulb so basically it is an audible switch; no dimming, and unreliable connection. I do not think these are worth the expense I could have used in a WeMo or other such system. Severely dissapointed. From a tech expert, do not buy. Inferior product. All four are being returned tomorrow.
customer_reviews.author: John J

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Outlet TImers
customer_reviews.text: I've tried a variety of hubless WiFi switches and bulbs, and TP-Link has been the most consistent product I've found. The timers switch on and off when they're supposed to, the app is well designed and efficient, and everything links seamlessly with my Home Minis (not Alexa, the other company). I have 3 of these switches, 8 TP-Link bulbs, and 4 GE bulbs. The GE bulbs are the only ones that ever give me problems.
customer_reviews.author: I can't believe I everything and what

customer_reviews.title: Not dangerous, but have had 2 fail under higher loads - UPDATE 4
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE I've heard from TP-Link and they are telling me that any incandescent sources (I think they mean sustained loads in general) cannot exceed 600 Watts. I have not found any documentation about this sustained (vs. peak) load limit and so I will be removing all 4 of these devices from service. I will be re-reviewing these more in depth to find out while the relays have failed.
customer_reviews.author: wentintothewoods

customer_reviews.title: Used to like until they stopped working
customer_reviews.text: I have several sets of TP Link smart plugs as well as bulbs & until now have never had a problem. But this last set of 2 plugs for some reason has just stopped working. All my firmware is updated & I have done the factory reset on both of these plugs 3 times. Unfortunately they are no longer discoverable on the network & the 30 day return window has just passed. So I guess I'm stuck with them. Very disappointed! I was really liking TP Link products, but now I think I'll reconsider any future smart home purchases from them.
customer_reviews.author: darren alan

customer_reviews.title: Worthless
customer_reviews.text: This switch is great in theory. I have 1 of 3 that work. 2 of them I go through the setup instructions but never complete, I end up with a blinking green WiFi light. No instructions anywhere on what that means other than setup failed. This product should be discontinued until they can figure out a more reliable setup. All the setup were done within 20 feet of my WiFi router, direct line of sight. All my other WiFi devices work great. I should have stuck with the leviton zwave outlets.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Smart Plugins
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these after purchasing the first one. It is extremely nice to be able to use my cell phone to turn on & off my lamps in the bedroom & Living room. First I hate walking into a Dark room & having to find a light switch. Second, I have 3 pets, two small dogs that tend to get in front of my in their excitement esp. in the morning, so the danger of tripping over them is alleviated since with the lights on, I can see them. It works flawlessly, I also have a decorative lamp up high where I can't reach it and this allows me to turn it off and on without difficulty!
customer_reviews.author: CLM

customer_reviews.title: Would Never Connect
customer_reviews.text: I could never get it to connect. I would get to the final step again and again - only to have to start over again. Finally returned it. The process doesn't seem so different from the process of setting up a Dot or Google Home - both of which I was able to do. Might have had something to do with my old router but since I didn't feel like buying a new router just to test that theory, I gave up on the TP-Link.
customer_reviews.author: J David

customer_reviews.title: Easy to connect
customer_reviews.text: I now have 4 of these controlling all the lights in my apartment. I love how easy they are to connect and program. I have it set so all of my lights turn on and off at different times. I use them with the smart phone app and Alexa for when I need light and they’re not scheduled. I’ll be buying more to fully connect all of my electronics. Only down side is that they are large and make it difficult to plug more than one plug in on an outlet but I just use a plug bar to make it easy.
customer_reviews.author: bchads

customer_reviews.title: Smart House!
customer_reviews.text: Love these! We've set these up on every lamp and air conditioning unit in our house and connected them all to Amazon Alexa! It's especially great to turn on our air conditioner before getting home so it's nice and cool! These smart plugs are very plug-and-play and rarely have any glitches.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working with Alexa after one week. I have ...
customer_reviews.text: ***UPDATE** Two days after I left the initial review, a firmware update was released that has solved the issue. Stopped working with Alexa after one week. I have gone through all of the troubleshooting steps suggested. I have uninstalled and reinstalled over and over. I can control it with my phone on the tp-kasa app, but it's unresponsive to Alexa. The only reason I got it was to work with my groups with Alexa. Also, the design of the plug is round at the bottom, which basically means you cannot use a two outlet plug for more than one item. You can't plug anything in, because the bottom of this plug blocks it.
customer_reviews.author: Radmom

customer_reviews.title: great alternative to high-priced competitors
customer_reviews.text: **Update: Have had a few of these plugs for about a year now, and they're still going strong. Repurposing/Renaming controlled devices is easy, and connecting Christmas Tree lights is THE GREATEST IDEA EVER! Stop crawling under the tree or leaving a foot pedal exposed to turn the tree on and off and plug your lights into this smart plug. Whether controlling through the standalone Kasa app or telling Alexa to turn on the tree, you will wish you had tried this sooner. Original Review: Works well, paired easily with home wifi, and Alexa/Echo, and accompanying mobile app is easy to use with or without other smart home systems.
customer_reviews.author: JOK says

customer_reviews.title: Had it for months, VERY reliable, very happy!
customer_reviews.text: ...I also torture tested it the first few weeks with connecting it to my AC (along with turning it on and off a bit) and it did swimmingly! I've had it for months, use it daily, it's very reliable. (I've tried other smart plugs and SEVERAL have just died within a LITERAL WEEK of basic use), so I've been very thankful and pleased with Kasa and WILL be getting more plugs from this company. Thanks so much for making my dingy trailer home feel futuristic, hahah.
customer_reviews.author: D

customer_reviews.title: Was an excellent piece of equipment until it stopped working with my ...
customer_reviews.text: Was an excellent piece of equipment until it stopped working with my Echo. The only reason why I bought them in the first place. I want a refund! Update: It seems that this was an issue with Amazon and not with this product. After I posted the negative review, they responded quickly to help explain the issue. I also heard on the radio this morning that it was an error made by one of Amazon's people that input a wrong command and messed up some cloud functions. Of well. It happens. Now I just have to get home and set it all up again.
customer_reviews.author: Jaycue

customer_reviews.title: junk
customer_reviews.text: Installed the TP-Link smart plug, and started using it on a lamp in the living room. The first two days, there was no issue at all. The next two days, when I would open the app to turn it on, it would briefly flash "no devices installed," but then change to the normal working screen. Two days after that, it just said no devices installed yet, and never changed. I decided to start over with it and set it up again from scratch... but the app can't find it at all now. These "smart plugs" are really smart at getting your money... no so smart when it comes to working. Save yourself time and money - look for something else.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works flawlessly.
customer_reviews.text: This was easy to set up and then integrate with Alexa. It's an easy two step process. Once with the Kasa App and then once with Alexa. I bought them to use as timers, and it was easy to set on and off times. It worked perfectly. Alexa turns the lamps on and off, or you can use the Alexa app, or Kasa app. You would not need an Amazon Echo to use these, just the Kasa app, if you dont have an Echo. I can now toss those old, old, twist the dial and push in setting timers. I think they were vintage, lol! Highly recommend these great smart plug.
customer_reviews.author: S. Baker

customer_reviews.title: I now have a number of smart plugs and switches from a number of different companies ...
customer_reviews.text: Sadly, I now have a number of smart plugs and switches from a number of different companies and all work well EXCEPT the TP-Link ones. My Echo Plus is constantly telling me that "TP-Link is not responding" when plugs and switches from other companies seem to be doing fine. Sometimes the Echo will say that the "TP-Link is not responding" but then the light or switch does respond about 10 seconds later. I don't know why TP-Link devices have to be closer to the router than the other devices to work and even then don't always respond. It's like they need a first non-responsive signal to start listening and then on the next request maybe they'll respond.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Frequently disconnects from wifi
customer_reviews.text: These used to work without issue. But lately they stay disconnecting from wifi and won't be able to visible in the kasa app. I already didn't like how they took up an entire outlet and switched to the mini for that reason. But I'm further dismayed at them daily having issues with staying on wifi. My mini is the same distance from router and doesn't have this issue as much. The timer features tend to work regardless so I guess it has some memory. I'm considering trying another brand in hopes it doesn't have the issue of disconnecting so much.
customer_reviews.author: Special K

customer_reviews.title: Works fine, but you better have really good WiFi
customer_reviews.text: As the headline says. Alexa never had any problem controlling it when it was actually on my network. I even added a crappy Netlink extender between the switches and my AP, and it did shockingly little good. When placed in other rooms and used for other things they could be reasonably reliable, but for my intended application they don't work. I will find a use for them somewhere with good signal, and probably hack a better antenna onto them because I am an engineer and can do that kind of thing, but due to their weak RF performance I would suggest caveat emptor.
customer_reviews.author: Don Stratton

customer_reviews.title: Poorly designed...You will only be able to use one plug on the outlet.
customer_reviews.text: The smart adapter is too large and does not leave room to use the bottom outlet. 1/4-1/3 of an inch and you would be able to use the bottom outlet. Very unfortunate. I will search for a better product. The device is easy to activate and use through the company’s app.
customer_reviews.author: Kat

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to use.. Terrible to use in a standard wall socket.
customer_reviews.text: These are awesome and work really well as long as you don't want anything to be plugged in any proximity to them. I love mine, but can't believe that whoever designed these had ever tried to manage plugged in things in their own house. You can't possibly use this in a wall outlet ant use the other plug.. not a chance in hell unless you are using a powerstrip and sacrificing plugs off that. On the plus side though, the app is super easy to set up and use. My problem is pretty much with the lack of design thought in the actual device.
customer_reviews.author: SCOTT GOODGAME

customer_reviews.title: I would buy these again
customer_reviews.text: These smart plugs work very nicely, and integrate quite well with Alexa. I have 4 of these, with various lamps plugged into them. For the most part, I use the scheduling feature of the Kasa app to control when they turn on and off. One feature I would add to the app is the ability to set a schedule based on sunrise or sunset. I'd love to schedule a lamp to turn on, for example, 10 minutes before sunset. If that feature was added, these would be perfect for me.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great smart plug for lights
customer_reviews.text: I gave up recently on a well-known and marketed smart plug because it kept dropping off my WiFi ... and the plugs did not fit all sockets ... AND, perhaps most importantly, the software was not easy to use ... it had not been updated for several years. Enter the Kasa Smart Plug. Great software, intuitive design and set up and the two units I bought have worked beautifully ever since ... The Alexa integration was smooth and error free I highly recommend these bad boys
customer_reviews.author: Bob Dutton

customer_reviews.title: Great for timers
customer_reviews.text: These are inexpensive, easy to setup and work great with Alexa. I used to have an assortment of smart switches from several vendors and these were the best. I eventually gave away the older switches to friends and consolidated all of them to tplink since it is more convenient to have them managed with one app, and having only a single reliable connection to the alexa skill. TP Link issues periodic updates to their app and firmware so you feel that they are on top of things and you are not being orphaned.
customer_reviews.author: John Borges

customer_reviews.title: A Little too Bulky but overall a good product
customer_reviews.text: The setup was very easy, easy app download and setup, I like that you can override the schedule to turn the outlet off/on manually via the app.. The only reason I gave it 4 out of 5 stars is the size...It is bulky, not as streamlined as I would have liked, but it is my first wifi plug. It takes up quite a bit of the outlet space. But overall I am pleased.. I am going to purchase more WIFI plugs, same manufacturer just a different model, I didn't see the slimmer ones until after I ordered this one.
customer_reviews.author: ElizabethH

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable and way too big.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this plug because it seemed to have good reviews, but my experience with it has been pretty bad overall. I use other Alexa-compatible plugs without any issues, but this plug isn’t always responsive or is very delayed (I’m taking 30 second delay) in turning on. This coupled with the fact that it’s absolutely HUGE and takes up about 3 slots on a power strip ensure that I’ll never buy this plug again.
customer_reviews.author: VCM

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable
customer_reviews.text: Does not work well with Alexa. I've had this for about 2 years. Every few months, Alexa just says "something went wrong" and the only way I've found to get it working again is to delete it from Alexa and re-add the configuration. Now that's not even working, it won't find the device. It still works from the kasa app, but can't setup in Alexa anymore. So if your idea of home automation is a device that keeps failing and requires way too much tinkering and reconfiguration, then this is for you.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: High Defective Ratio
customer_reviews.text: Based on my (limited) experience, 1 defective unit out of 3 seems a bit high. Defective unit is under warranty but it took a couple of attempts and a couple of weeks to reach customer service. Unit is now being returned for replacement. I assumed correctly that I would have to pay return shipping costs but feel a bit aggrieved since all I did was open the box; Kasa provided the defective product. The two working units are effective although a bit clunky and prevent anything else being plugged into the wall. All in all a decent enough product when it works. And helpful customer support when they can be contacted.
customer_reviews.author: james d. thomas

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful
customer_reviews.text: These were my second chance at adding plugs to my Google app. Thank you to the manufacturers that put the MAC address on the product! You scored a ten on that alone. One attached to the KASA app, I was able to add to my google home set up. I definitely will be buying more. I do wish that they were smaller but this is worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Nia

customer_reviews.title: Beware of warranty
customer_reviews.text: Bought another one of these units to replace a failed one of the same type even though it was still under warranty. I was using two of them in a group for lights, so wanted to keep them the same. After many calls and emails with support, they agreed to replace the unit, however they then mentioned they wanted the old one mailed back at my cost, ($14.35 USPS). It was cheaper to purchase a new one here on Amazon for $13.99, throw the old one out, and skip any further trust/contact with support. I thought I was a TP-Link fan. Not any longer...
customer_reviews.author: RD

customer_reviews.title: Pair with an Echo for voice control - perfect for disabled and elderly
customer_reviews.text: My husband was dealing with physical ailments and needed eye surgery. I bought several of these smart plugs so he could voice control the lamps in several rooms. The results were liberating, giving him control over this aspect of his life again. Unfortunately he has since passed away, I appreciate the sense of freedom to control the lights (and thermostat, the door locks and much much more with other devices and multiple Echo and Dots in various rooms...) this setup was able to provide him in his final stage of life. For that sense of liberation despite his physical situation I'll always be thankful.
customer_reviews.author: JeriOwl

customer_reviews.title: Melted itself. Unsafe. Do not buy.
customer_reviews.text: The unit was pulling less than 1200w when rated for 1600, and melted my wall socket, and itself. Glad I had a fire extinguisher. UNSAFE. Do not buy.
customer_reviews.author: Jp

customer_reviews.title: Perfect buy!
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic addition to any smart home! These plugs work with Alexa as well as google home. Name them whatever you like in the appropriate app and the control is now digitized and in the palm of your hand or the sound of your voice. I use one for the fan in my bedroom. Set up google home and now when I say goodnight google, the fan turns on following my daily news recap and weather for tomorrow. These plugs are a great buy and very simple to set up and use. Every home automation set up should highlight the ease and accessibility of this plug!
customer_reviews.author: Steve Shelton

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to connect to connect but lot of problems
customer_reviews.text: Vet easy to connect to the internet It connects in second Anyone can do it However, too many on going problems Be aware to have time and patience The switch drop off the internet by itself and the only way you can get it back on line it physically unplug it (bear in mind you place the switch behind a 200 lbs bed, you have to work your way behind that heavy bed again Would not recommend, too many on going problems
customer_reviews.author: Edmond

customer_reviews.title: Poor service by TP Link
customer_reviews.text: I purchased three of these units and configured all three and was able to control the units both locally and remotely. One of the units stopped working so I attempted re-configuration using the same procedure used when I first set up the three. The remote connection failed so I did a factory reset and attempted reconfiguration. Once again remote connection was unavailable and would not remain on after attempting to switch it on. I refused to make changes in my Wi-Fi router because other HS100 units in my home are working properly. The unit has a 2 year warranty and it appears that TP Link does not want to replace it.
customer_reviews.author: L. Perry

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful device for voice activation in your home with Alexa
customer_reviews.text: I use this as a way to turn my bedside light on when I get home. All I have to do is say the phrase I set up to turn on my bedside light ( which illuminates the whole room). Now, you need to be sure to read the instructions carefully and not just jump ahead, because it is easy to miss something. EG: the app to put on your phone to connect Alexa, your plug and the name of your room/device/object its plugged into. Now, the timer aspect can be a bit annoying to set. But once it is set, you are ready to roll. Which works great for xmas lights in your house.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Got bit
customer_reviews.text: Not sure what is wrong and I'll try it in another location but the metal part of the switch behind the toggle was hot. I touched it and got a jolt of 120 AC. The switch was activated and connected to the network but it would not turn on the light. There is a white {neutral), black (hot), and green _ground. in the switch. I double checked the connections and even swapped the black load/line wires to be sure. The volt meter measured 120 VAC on the input and output of the switch when activated so not sure why the light would not come on.
customer_reviews.author: tim

customer_reviews.title: be very close to router like same power strip to program
customer_reviews.text: I could not get plugs to work so for months I just used the button to turn lamps on and off on desk top. Today I read more closely. Plugged one into outlet next to router restarted router, went to Kasa app. Followed instructions until network request. Went to iPad settings made sure WiFi was on and turned on Bluetooth. After Bluetooth found it, click on plug name one time, back to KASA and follow directions. Kasa will ask for home network name and password.
customer_reviews.author: Anna Leuenberger

customer_reviews.title: Not an easy set up
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to power a lamp, I thought it would be easy to link it to Alexa and google home. After following all the steps pretty quickly, I was stopped in my tracks because it does not work with unsecured WiFi. We live in a remote area where NO one could use our signal without sitting in our driveway, which we would notice. No close neighbors and no roads less than a quarter mile away. So this senior citizen will need to spend a full day setting up the secured WiFi and linking 2 TVs, the blue ray, 3 iPads, 2 google home , 2 alexas, an iPhone and maybe the kindle. Not happy!!!
customer_reviews.author: Gardengirl

customer_reviews.title: really enjoyed the and the app is great
customer_reviews.text: we now own bodies we really enjoy them their great for pairing with Alexa and I'm sure other devices to turn on and off lights verbally. We use them also for holiday lights and seasonal decoration. I really like the app the billiard control all of the smart devices and the way it interacts with the Alexa home is wonderful. Thanks features to set up vacation mode for thinking different plumbed throughout your house. The most part set up has been very easy I think one plug. One but the other ones simply and quickly think about Bluetooth and are Alexa home.
customer_reviews.author: Logan Miller

customer_reviews.title: Not as Dependable as Wemo plugs
customer_reviews.text: I have two Wemo plugs I use with my Amazon Echo. Never have had a problem with them in over a year. This plug I bought, as it was $10 cheaper. I always heard you get what you pay for. This one has failed twice, so I have had to spend hours trouble shooting, reinstalling, etc. One time there was a software issue, and I guess everyone had problems. For the $10 I saved by not getting a Wemo, I probably lost $50 in aggrevation and time wasted. Buy Wemo smart plugs is my recommendation!
customer_reviews.author: Flossygirl

customer_reviews.title: Not ready for Prime time
customer_reviews.text: This thing may work with some Echo devices but it does not work with mine. It's easy to establish a connection with my Iphone but Alexa needs the WiFi connection this device produces. Or at least is supposed to produce. Mine produces nothing. The app whirs and whirs but finds nothing. OTOH it works fine using my cell phone so I guess I can use my cell phone as a remote controller. Not what I ordered and thought I was getting though. I recommend waiting for this device to mature into reliability
customer_reviews.author: Couerleroi

customer_reviews.title: Really Bulky, Not My Go To
customer_reviews.text: These functioned fine. But man they take up so much space. If you are using a long single row extension cord, even if you put it at the end, it takes up 2 outlets. On the square double row extension cords, it does the same, unless they are super space out, which are harder to find. Its just super bulky. I still use them, but I switched out most of them out, for the wyze outlets, they are smaller and since I have more products by them, it just makes since. I've been working on condensing all of the different apps I have to use, for all the different products and wyze is winning.
customer_reviews.author: JTShopper

customer_reviews.title: Look elsewhere
customer_reviews.text: Don’t bother! These products are constantly dropping WiFi signals and need to be reset once a week. I’ve invested a significant amount into these plugs and have come away completely frustrated. Emails to the support team resulted in an endless loop of the same questions with no actual help or suggestions. I have these plugs connected to a 2.4 ghz wireless network with a dedicated Netgear router. Signal strength I strong. Product and support are inferior. Look for other products that will provide more stability. Complete waste of time.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Ginsberg

customer_reviews.title: Look elsewhere for your smart home.
customer_reviews.text: We have two of these and both suffer the same issues. Product has terrible time finding wifi signal 10-15 feet from the router. They lose connection every couple days, if we can get them to connect at all. And when it disconnects it requires you to remove the device and go through setup all over again. Infuriating product which now sits in a drawer because it's not worth the trouble.
customer_reviews.author: J. Larkin

customer_reviews.title: Remote switches
customer_reviews.text: I had remote switches from Radio Shack up north. They worked okay, but had a dedicated controller that had to be "in range" of all of the remotes. When I moved to Florida, I needed something to replace them. These are just the ticket! They are far superior, and easy to program. Since they run on your home WiFi, you use your smart phone to control them, you can turn them on and off from anywhere in the world. I keep adding more. They also have an "all on/all off" feature for Christmas lights etc
customer_reviews.author: Jamie Halstead

customer_reviews.title: Works with some devices
customer_reviews.text: Absurdly bad design that it uses one outlet and blocks the second one. Their "mini" doesn't block the other outlet but of course the mini is more expensive. Obviously it can turn all devices off because it's killing the power but it only turns some on. I'm assuming it may not work on a lot of modern devices that don't have a physical on/off button. DEVICES IT DOES TURN ON: - Pioneer plasma TV (it's from around 2005) - Apple TV - Amazon Fire TV - Samsung BD-J5100 Curved Blu-ray Player (2015 Model) DEVICES IT DOES NOT TURN ON: - Holigoo Table Lamp, Touch Control Bedside Lamp - Bose SoundTouch 130 Home Theater System
customer_reviews.author: @RyanMoore

customer_reviews.title: Good concept, but lacking.
customer_reviews.text: Good concept, but lacking the true details. First, the mobile app to control is a nice feature. However? Unfortunately it does not appear to be fully integrated, in that it will show the 'outlet' powered even when I have it unplugged, sitting on the table. The 'programmability' is a good start, but again I'm not confident it's always on or off when I expect it to be. I'll experiment with that feature more. Second, the control is 'Local only.' Meaning I have no control if I am not @ home on the same WiFi as the unit. (Save the programed times.)
customer_reviews.author: R. Kelley

customer_reviews.title: connection problems went away
customer_reviews.text: Updated review: I just updated this review from 1 star to 4. This due to the fact that after having the connection problems described below several months have gone by with this problem not occurring so I decided my original review was unfair. I don't know why they are working reliably now. I didn't change anything in my network, didn't update drivers etc. Original review: occasionally disconnects and I have to unplug and plug back in to reconnect. Power cycling the router does not work. If I'm away from home I can't reconnect and then it is useless. I checked firmware January 2019 and it's up to date. Not worth the trouble.
customer_reviews.author: Ken

customer_reviews.title: Do Not Recommend for Amazon Echo
customer_reviews.text: It doesn't work about 50% of the time. I bought one of the wireless outlets as a trial and plugged my TV into it. Today, for example, I was able to use Alexa to turn the TV on: "Alexa, turn the TV on", but twenty minutes later, when I said, "Alexa, turn the TV off," she responds with 'thinking' for about 10 seconds and then saying "Sorry, the device 'the TV' is not responding." How does this change in TWENTY MINUTES? I can turn off the outlet manually from the Kasa app, but I bought this outlet specifically because of how it was reviewed/rated to work with Alexa. What a waste.
customer_reviews.author: APM

customer_reviews.title: Stopped Working
customer_reviews.text: This product has been working fine but as of today it has completely stopped working with Alexa. I have no idea why. You can't even enable the app anymore. I would not buy this until more is figured out or the issue is fixed. It makes the device mostly worthless for me because it no longer integrates with Alexa or works with voice command through Alexa. Luckily I only have one of these outlets. I guess I'll just buy the Phillips ones from now on.
customer_reviews.author: Michael J. Duda

customer_reviews.title: Works well!
customer_reviews.text: It works great and is pretty responsive with only a slight delay. The only downfall is the size...It's incredibly bulky so you can't have anything close to the wall in front of it and you can only use the other outlet if you have a standard plug (Not like a MacBook charger or something) Overall it does what it's supposed to and works seamlessly with Alexa, but you can find way better options for the same price.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler

customer_reviews.title: KASA app doesn't always work - it frequently freezes up
customer_reviews.text: While the plug itself has shown no particular problem when the KASA app sees it, the app itself often hangs when reviewing schedule or trying to display runtime, or trying to turn on/off from the smartphone screen. Going back and forth between the devices summary screen and the specific device screen usually unfreezes it, but still it would be a headache for devices that get controlled a lot. Also I haven't determined if the schedule functions reliably or if it also freezes up which would leave the device stuck ON or OFF when it's not supposed to.
customer_reviews.author: DVD

customer_reviews.title: Works with Kasa but Doesn’t  work with Alexa
customer_reviews.text: Somewhat cumbersome installation. Finally got it to work with the Kasa application. Never managed to get it to mesh with Alexa, no matter what I tried. And I followed all the instructions very closely, NUMEROUS times. I ordered this in December 2017 and only attempted to install it now, December 2018. Became pretty frustrated with it in the end and uninstalled it, and deleted the Kasa application. All this rigmarole for something that is essentially a light timer switch, and then it doesn’t even deliver what it promises. But I absolutely LOVE the Amazon smart plug. Works like a charm and was extremely easy to install.
customer_reviews.author: RX

customer_reviews.title: Works Good With Window AC
customer_reviews.text: I wanted this plug to be able to turn my mobile home living room window AC on to cool down the home before I get there. It hot Bakersfield, this is a must. Turning it on 45 minutes prior is usually sufficient. Considering I get home at different times each day, this plug works better than the AC's timer function. The 15 amp rating of the plug works fine with the 12,000 Btu AC, which is rated at 8.5 amps. Knowing I'd be home soon, I used the Kasa app to turn it on for the first time while starting my supermarket shopping. SO convenient.
customer_reviews.author: Dirk Gates

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set up to communicate over network
customer_reviews.text: These things just work, without a lot of jumping through hoops to get them to talk to a home automation system. I have a Raspberry Pi, it was a piece of cake to get them to talk to it over the network. They are somewhat bulky, and at $20/device, a little expensive (Amazon does occasionally put them on sale at a steeper discount) , but it was great to finally find something to control lights in my house that works over the network and is easy to set up. I plan to get more of them as I expand my HA system.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: When your 2.4 Ghz stops working you can spend the next month with their non-technical support
customer_reviews.text: I really liked these plugs. However, within my warranty period, one of them died: First contact, had me do a bunch of troubleshooting steps I had done already. Was told their expert would contact me. I waited 5 days and contacted them again. More steps. 2 days later received an email to do these steps. 1 day later, new email with more steps. same day, new email with more steps Of course I am doing their troubleshooting for them before they will send a 5.00 value refurbished plug. Don't waste your time.
customer_reviews.author: Dragonspawn

customer_reviews.title: Works well with Google Home mini
customer_reviews.text: This smart plug is awesome. It was very easy to connect to the WiFi and stays connected. I have had no issues with it so far. Keep in mind that you do have to download their app to utilize it to connect it to your Google Home app. Not really a big deal since every smart plug you have to download their proprietary app. One thing I do think is a negative with this plug is that it is huge. It takes up two plugs on my power strip.
customer_reviews.author: Jules B

customer_reviews.title: Super easy to use and setup
customer_reviews.text: I really like this WiFi plug. It works without a hub and without Alexa. I replaced a plug in timer with this Wi-Fi plug and was not sure I was going to like it. Turns out I do like it. Super easy to set up and super easy to use and set a schedule. It also works with my Samsung SMART THINGS app, which turned out to be a BIG bonus. I use the plug for a lamp and the only draw back is the WiFi plug will not work as a dimmer. It’s either ON or OFF.
customer_reviews.author: H. Brown

customer_reviews.title: I like it
customer_reviews.text: This is my third one of these. I got it to control my outside Christmas lights. Note that the device is rated for indoor use only, but mine is on a covered porch, and it hasn't been getting too cold where I live, so I'm not really concerned. This is my 3rd TP-Link Smart Plug, and they're currently all connected to Christmas lights or trees. During the "off season" I use them for lamps around the house. These plugs are great with Alexa voice control. They would be even better with a smart home hub, which I don't have, to enable automatic timers. My "Alexa, lights out" routine turns off all my stuff at night.
customer_reviews.author: Strong Bad

customer_reviews.title: Worked Great
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to control lights while we are traveling. Easy to set up and works great. Tested while I was away and my wife was home to confirm. Worked great! Plan on ordering a couple more. I had the Belkin WiFi outlets before and they were OK IF I were in the house and on our wireless network, but failed miserably when I was away from our WiFi. These are so much simpler than the Belkins and work SOOOOO much better. I recommend buying the Kasa but will never buy Belkins.
customer_reviews.author: Yaron

customer_reviews.title: A must have for gardeners.
customer_reviews.text: Good stuff but sometimes the wrong kasa app get me hard time . Two kasa apps one for every models and one just for newer model. And sometimes your phone connects to 5.0 channels on the router instead of 2.4 then it will not working. Goodluck customer. Other than that it's just a good piece of stuff. I used it to be a remote control for the sprinklers water pump. I like the app that let me timer or set schedule to water my garden much more easy than the one mechanical or digital timer with a small remote control too easy to loose and not last in the weather.
customer_reviews.author: tomma

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Wifi Plug
customer_reviews.text: So far so good with this product. It was a replacement for a wifi plug that failed for some reason. This device has an easy to download application with excellent features for timers, schedules, etc. If I had anything that I did not like it would be the size as it takes up two spaces on my surge protector. If it was a bit smaller or could be plugged in a different way so I did not lose an plug it would be excellent. However, that is the only thing I dislike.
customer_reviews.author: E. Spruill

customer_reviews.title: Covers both plugs in a outlet.....rendering one unusable!
customer_reviews.text: I was surprised to find that this smart plug covers both plugs in the outlet, rendering one unusable. It was also hard to connect to my Echo Dot. I admit that I am not very tech savvy, but had no difficulties setting up the Echo. Once setup was finally completed, it worked fine, but was harder to use the App. I ended up returning it because, when all is said and done, I did not have enough outlets to have one unusable, since it is located in one of my most used rooms.
customer_reviews.author: PaulieP

customer_reviews.title: Waste of Time
customer_reviews.text: After an hour of trying to get them to connect I find out that you have to disable your firewalls to allow them to be remotely accessed while out of your home. I have no idea how to do that and I'm not going to waste any more time. If you only have 1 and want to control it from your phone by DIRECTLY from your phone's WiFi(meaning you cannot have your phone connected to your home WiFi, at the same time) then maybe this product is great. I wanted to connect it to my Alexa, but it needs to be able to be remotely controlled. So that's my money well wasted.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: App incompatible with older firmware, and no way to update firmware with a Mac or an iPhone
customer_reviews.text: iPhone stopped being able to control the Smart Plugs, so I contacted TP-Link's tech support and their solution was "update your firmware." They said "Go borrow a PC from someone. We don't have any Mac applications." Their iPhone app will not update Smart Plugs. Tech support admitted that when they update their app, it often becomes incompatible with older firmware on the Smart Plugs, but.. you get the idea. Now I have 3 Smart Plugs that the app can neither see nor control, so it won't have the misfortune of watching me pitch these into the trash.
customer_reviews.author: SnouterShooter

customer_reviews.title: The best wifi plug you can get and not be wasting your money.
customer_reviews.text: I used this for my pool pump. I placed it under the house, out of the weather and used the kasa app. to set the timer. We always run the pump while swimming, so if it is not running, even my 5 and 6 year old and can tell the wifi speaker to turn the pool pump on. That makes life easier, than manually turning it on everytime. If I forget, it on, I can use my phone to turn it off from anywhere. I tried some of the cheaper wifi plugs first..... don't waste your time and money. They didn't work out the box.
customer_reviews.author: glendon fleming

customer_reviews.title: They just work
customer_reviews.text: There are lots of plugs on Amazon with fake reviews. This one seemed legit and I've actually heard of TP-LINK before. I've bought 6 over the past year. They are easy to set up, play well with everything else I have (Alexa, SmartThings). Most importantly, they just work and haven't needed to be reset in the past year. They also have a built in timer feature that I didn't care about at first, but have ended up using to reboot flaky hardware nightly. My only complaint at all is they are a bit bulky, but they work great and that is what matters. There are smaller ones, but these are cheap and seem like the highest rated.
customer_reviews.author: S. Miller

customer_reviews.title: Shouldn't have to work this hard...
customer_reviews.text: Spent 2 hours trying to set up on friend's computer. Brought home and spent 1 hour trying to set up on my computer. Followed all instructions. (App on my phone. Working in Alexa app. to set up skill, etc.) Even went to provided T-Link technical support link. (What a disorganized mess!) I'm reasonably tech savvy with a Wi-fi home. (Wireless printer. 1 echo and 2 echo dots. Blue tooth speakers. Smart tv's, etc.) But if I have to work this hard to set up a product (and still not succeed), it's not worth it. Good luck to those with happy success with the T-Link 100. I'll wait for something easier to install.
customer_reviews.author: paulus

customer_reviews.title: Get things done by doing nothing
customer_reviews.text: I've spent my entire life working to get to the point where I could retire and enjoy doing nothing. This Smart plug really helps me do that. I have a half dozen of these plus some smart switches and light bulbs. With those and a few Amazon Dots and Wands I can control lights, my television and amplifier from anywhere in my house. I also have a Dot in my car so I can turn on the porch light, living room light and the television as I return from somewhere and pull into my driveway. I am continually amazed by how much I can do by doing nothing.
customer_reviews.author: John Vandraiss

customer_reviews.title: Works with Google Home
customer_reviews.text: This purchase was the fifth plug I have purchased. I had no problems connecting to my WiFi and Google finding the plug. It was very convenient to be able to connect the Christmas lights and have them turn on or off automatically. (I did not use the plug outside but connected lights to outlet in the garage.). I am able by command to turn on all lights in the living room or just the Christmas lights. I also have the same brand light switches in my bedroom controlling the overhead light and ceiling fan.
customer_reviews.author: SLB

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the headache
customer_reviews.text: This device works about 40% of the time. I have uninstalled the device, reset it. The power shows it is on and ready but when you ask Alexa to turn off/on the lamp it often says “the light is not responding at this time” but wait and try again and random times it decides to work. I have tried to troubleshoot the device multiple times and I am beyond frustrated from what was to be a simple to use device for my kids room.
customer_reviews.author: grokgirl

customer_reviews.title: Easy to setup! High quality made!
customer_reviews.text: This smart plug was very easy to setup. You could probably get a cheaper smart plug, but this one made for a high current. Which tells me it's made to last longer. Worth the price. Just follow the instructions, install the user friendly Kasa app. And "let there be light" My lamp is plugged into the smart plug. Now i have the option of switching lamp on or off with either the echo input device or with the Kasa app on my smartphone. Pretty damn neat.
customer_reviews.author: Kleve

customer_reviews.title: It was a great relationship...then those app updates
customer_reviews.text: Bought this September '18 and really liked being able to control home devices while traveling. Everything was fine for 2-3 months then those dang app updates started messing up the functionality. First to go was the timer...then after another Kasa app update the plug would not power on from the app. Lands in the e-waste basket until the next recycling event.
customer_reviews.author: detconnection

customer_reviews.title: so I as very disappointed when I was not able to control my Christmas ...
customer_reviews.text: Was excited to get this product but it didn't work very well. I could hook it up to my phone but it wouldn't connect to our alexa (our entire house is 'smart'... lights, thermostat, 4 alexas, she even starts my truck for me)... so I as very disappointed when I was not able to control my Christmas tree with her! It like creates its own hotspot and requires alexa to be on that instead of the house wifi. Also, it takes up both of the outlets, how impractical is that. Very disappointed, I will be returning both of them.
customer_reviews.author: Charles O'Donnell

customer_reviews.title: Product is good, Customer service sucks. no help what so ever
customer_reviews.text: initial set up was fine. when I changed my WIFI password, one device would not reprogram. Fredie was the worst. and on top of that I had the current d, he had me uninstall and reinstall, now I have to reconnect all the devices I had already connected this morning. Though he had me waste a lot of time, and provided zero solution, I made the decision to replace my router, all problems solved. I would have rated them a 4 star if not for the poor customer service. might be beneficial if they read the initial thread rather than leaving you hanging while they help 12 people at once.
customer_reviews.author: Stanmrvan

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money. DO NOT BUY.
customer_reviews.text: When it works, it's great. Problem is, it rarely works. I was controlling my bedroom lamp with it, and every time I asked Alexa to turn on my lamp, same response. Tp link isn't responding. Then, the tedious task of going through the paring process all over again. Please save your money and use your hands to turn on those lamps and whatever else, like I do now.
customer_reviews.author: zach

customer_reviews.title: Good but sometimes loses connection
customer_reviews.text: Not a bad smart plug. I don’t use with Alexa so not sure about its compatibility. It sometimes loses connection to wifi which can be annoying but overall it’s a decent little smart plug. Generally if I refresh the app enough it’ll start picking the wifi back up but sometimes I’ll have to restart the plug itself. Good thing is the plug itself doesn’t turn off when not connected to wifi.
customer_reviews.author: Molly

customer_reviews.title: Kasa all over my house!
customer_reviews.text: I have Kasa plugs everywhere. My favorite use is for my wax burner and curling iron so I don’t forget to turn it off (I set the timer function for the burner and can check the app that they are off). I really like the away function...it’s not just a simple timer function but the light randomly turns on/off during the time period you select so it more realistically imitates someone being home.
customer_reviews.author: Heather Heyl

customer_reviews.title: Amazon to the rescue
customer_reviews.text: The customer service from KASA was hilarious. Each level has engineers said the same thing as the initial customer service. After 6 months remote control stops working plug says local only they went so far as to say change the modem when is their $14 plugs is not working. Instead of honoring their 2-year warranty and the product is only 6 months old they would rather take you through arduous troubleshooting instead of just honoring their warranty. Luckily Amazon step in and made it right. KASA is not compatible with the fire.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Excellent switch, could be smaller however.
customer_reviews.text: Great smart switch. The Kasa mobile app for iOS and Android works great and provides full functionality for this plug. The only reason I give it 4 stars is that is is larger than the other TP-Link smart switch that is also sold here on Amazon.com. The only downside to this switch is that due to its design, you cannot plug 2 of these into the same dual-gang outlet. This is unlike the other Kasa smart switch that TP-link makes which is a much smaller design that extends horizontally rather than vertically- enabling you to use two units 'stacked' one above/below the other. Overall, a great switch, easy to use, and reliable.
customer_reviews.author: Terence C. Mournet, Ph.D.

customer_reviews.title: Easy peasy set up and use!
customer_reviews.text: I have a LOT of devices on the Kasa products and I am very delighted with how easy they are to set up and how easy they are to program. I am pretty good at technology, but we all know that we are only as good as the technology is, and they have made it easy to do. I can set schedules and control at both my main house and vacation home with ease. I have to admit that in the beginning I had some fun with a relative turning things on and off remotely. After they freaked out, I apologized, but it was funny. I highly recommend their products!
customer_reviews.author: C. E. Gregory

customer_reviews.title: solid smart homing!
customer_reviews.text: So here's the deal, these plugs are great, easy to setup, good color, and mostly very reliable, but until they create an IFTT channel like all the other major smartlight manufacturers they are seriously set behind their competing products. I wish I'd gone with hue or one of the others so I could setup custom schedules and commands, if they get this issue corrected I will come back and update this review to reflect that. EDIT: IFTT support finally added! works great, no reason not to pull the trigger on these now!
customer_reviews.author: David T. Patry

customer_reviews.title: Kasa Smart WiFi Plug by TP-Link (2-Pack) – Great plugs
customer_reviews.text: You use these plugins with your wireless network. They are easy to install and setup. You can set them up to come on at one time or several times in a 24 hour period. I use them to turn off my lights when it starts to get dark out. When I am on vacation I set them up to come on an off at different times. I can change settings or turn off when I am away from home. They work as described and had no problems with them. I would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: GC

customer_reviews.title: User friendly
customer_reviews.text: I love these! Works with the Kasa app and Alexa. I love how they have a power button for when you just want to turn it on/off. Timer function works great. Also, I love how I can be on any of our WiFis and they still work, even though they were only set up on one of our networks. That might not seem like a big deal, but our TV remote apps have to be on the exact WiFi and it’s just annoying.
customer_reviews.author: J. Britain

customer_reviews.title: If you want hours of dead-ends and frustration, buy this plug
customer_reviews.text: I bought three of these a year ago and after much fuss got them working and connected to Alexa. Recently, two of them fell of the radar and I have spent hours upon hours trying to reconnect them, following TP-Link's instructions to the letter about seven times. My Wi-Fi is fine since one of the original plugs still work as do all other devices like Sonos that depend on it. TP-Link could learn a big lesson from Apple - ALL their products are intuitive and just about set themselves up. I think I can manage to turn two lights on manually like people have been doing for over 100 years.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce Drake

customer_reviews.title: Works great, covers second opening for outlet
customer_reviews.text: I bought these in June 2016, in case there is a newer model. The setup required installing the Kasa app, and went pretty smoothly. I had to delete my devices once to change which network they used, but was fairly straight forward. Then I enabled the skill in amazon echo, and now Alexa can control my lights. Voice recognition has been good and I'm pretty happy. However, looking at the picture, this device does cover the other set of openings to plug in something else on the outlet. If your family Strickland to find place to charge devices like mine does, this can be a factor. Otherwise I am happy.
customer_reviews.author: Tim from Arlington

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install smart plug
customer_reviews.text: I got this plug for $5 when I bought the Echo during CyberMonday. The plug was very easy to install (literally just plug it into an electrical outlet) and the app was easy to set up. Setting up with Echo was a bit confusing at first, pretty much you need to go to menu>>Smart Home>>Then tap on YOUR SMART HOME SKILL>>ENABLE SMART HOME SKILLS>>search for TP-Link Kasa>> Enable>>Then Alexa will search for it. After that, you can enjoy the convenience of controlling the device or appliance anywhere’s with your phone or Alexa.
customer_reviews.author: Gracie

customer_reviews.title: Huh?
customer_reviews.text: It will work with some challenges from your smart phone however getting it to work with Alexa, is another story. First you give the "Device" a name, then you make a "Group" and give it another name. Then you do something else and by the time you get it to work your sooo confused. I'm still not sure that Alexa is ready fo prime time. BTW, I have several switches that I want to rename but I don't dare. Maybe it's multiple Alexa's that causes thsee switches to suck. Plus several people, with different inflections in their voice causes Alexa to go into "huh?" mode. Oh, don't ask it any difficult questions.
customer_reviews.author: Rob369

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product to automate your everyday needs. It is user friendly with an easy installation process. I now havr 6 of them in use around the house. Kasa app is provided for all feaures available, and I have combined that with the Alexa app. Some people may complain about the size of the HS100, but I do not fond a problem with it. Added to that, even though I do not have one, they now have a newer model that is quite a bit smaller looking. So keep that in mind if you order one. I like the ones I have, and have not had any problems. Great product. Also, I have no connections to the company.
customer_reviews.author: Partsman

customer_reviews.title: Lil problem...
customer_reviews.text: The main problem with this outlet is if you have a coffee maker that also tells time, it won’t work even when you tell Alexa to turn it on. Mine just turned on and 5 min later I went out to get my freshly brewed coffee but it never brewed. It just turned on and the clock showed 12:05am. It was 8:30am. So if you have an appliance that has other functions within it, use the plug on a light or, as we did, out Christmas tree lights.
customer_reviews.author: JJB

customer_reviews.title: Don’t Recommend
customer_reviews.text: I’ve purchased TP Link products previously and was pleased with them. I must say I’m not pleased at spending 45 minutes on set up and this thing still will not connect. I’m showing a solid green light on the actual device. According to what I’ve read, means this is connected and working as expected. Yet, I keep getting a message on my phone stating that the setup has failed. This makes no sense. I’ve tried two different wireless networks in my home and get the same results. I think I’ve just purchased the wrong brand for this.
customer_reviews.author: Hawkstv

customer_reviews.title: Bad warranty
customer_reviews.text: Mine started making a loud noise while under warranty and TP-link asked me to pay for the shipping in order to receive a replacement. At 19$ for a 2-pack, shipping for one unit would cost about the same as buying a new one. TP-link needs to really stand by their products and offer no-cost service. I have already bought a replacement from a different vendor and will not buy TP-link again.
customer_reviews.author: Ana-Maria P

customer_reviews.title: They worked great with Alexa at first
customer_reviews.text: I bought 5 of these. They worked great with Alexa at first. After a few months all 5 appear offline to Alexa. Checking with Kasa app, it shows 2 of these devices are "local only." I tried reset, different wifi network etc. none works. Called TP-Link support, waited for 40 minutes before I could talk to someone. Another half hour trying different things: Turn off router firewall, upgrade firmware, uninstall, reinstall Kasa app etc. It turned out that to take care of the "local only" problem a firmware upgrade is needed. To take care of the "offline" problem on Alexa, I need to uninstall "Kasa" skill first hen reinstall Kasa skill on Alexa app.
customer_reviews.author: HL

customer_reviews.title: It works perfectly - note that it is big and bright - consider the "mini" version
customer_reviews.text: The operation of this plug is flawless - love it! The only reason I dinged it one star is because it is very large. It is often tough to put a second plug in the outlet, depending on the size and shape of the plug. If I bought again I'd get the "mini" version. But setup is super easy, and use with your phone or Amazon Echo is very easy and reliable. Only other knock is that the lights are pretty bright for bedroom use - I put a couple pieces of painters' tape over the lights and it's fine. Would be awesome if it had a setting to make it stay dark.
customer_reviews.author: Todd Starker

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set up, work great!
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased with these. I'd been wanting some smart plugs and there was a sale. Setup instructions were very clear, and setup was easy. You install an app to your phone or mobile device to set up the plugs. They do require a 2.4mhz band, and you must connect your phone to that network to set up the plugs, but once you've done that, you can connect your mobile devices to your faster network. There are also clear instructions for setting these up to work with your Amazon Echo, which works great. You can also set routines to have the lights come on and off or control them remotely.
customer_reviews.author: Betsy True

customer_reviews.title: Does NOT have energy monitoring
customer_reviews.text: This model (HS100) looks the same as the discontinued model with energy monitoring (HS110), but it does NOT have energy monitoring. 4 stars because this was basically my mistake (the description never claims it has energy monitoring) and I'm sure it works fine otherwise, just wanted to write a review in case other people come here looking for that feature.
customer_reviews.author: E. Craig

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME smart plug, SUPER EASY set-up - lifesaver.
customer_reviews.text: I have a TV that won't shut off, no joke. Other than its incessant need to keep turning itself back on all the time, it works beautifully. This smart plug is the answer to my problem. I can plug my possessed TV into it and when it starts with its antics, I can simply turn it off with a touch on my phone. Genius. I LOVE this smart plug, a few bucks and an incredibly easy setup and I no longer have to replace a stupid expensive TV. This smart plug is amazing! Super easy to set-up, works beautifully and is a lifesaver - well, a TV saver. LOVE it!
customer_reviews.author: SweetMagnolia24

product_meta.title: Kasa Smart Plug by TP-Link, Smart Home WiFi Outlet works with Alexa, Echo, Google Home & IFTTT, No Hub Required, Remote Control, 15 Amp, UL Certified, 1-Pack (HS100)
product_meta.description: Style:1-Pack| Pattern Name:PlugControl lighting and other appliances from anywhere with the Kasa Smart Wi Fi Plug. Schedule connected devices turn on when you get home, then power down when you go to sleep. Control each outlet individually or as one, set schedules or scenes, even use voice commands with Amazon Alexa, Google Assistant, or Microsoft Cortana.
feature_bullets: Control From Anywhere: Turn electronics on or off from anywhere with your smartphone using the Kasa app (Compatible w/ Android & iOS)

Voice control works with amazon Alexa, Google Assistant and Microsoft Cortana supported devices for a hands free experience; Operating temperature: 0 ºC to 40 ºC (32°F to 104°F). Operating humidity: 5 percent to 90 percent RH, Non condensing
Flexible control: UL certified to switch up to 15A, for flexible control of a wide range of plug in devices
Kasa scenes & schedules: Schedule the smart plug to automatically switch on and off when away or set a scene for controlling many devices with a single button
